thread.title: Tsipras set to unveil new cabinet
thread.title_full: Tsipras set to unveil new cabinet | Business Spectator

author: Dow Jones newswires
title: Tsipras set to unveil new cabinet
text:
Greece's newly-appointed Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras is expected to announce his government's cabinet later on Tuesday, with the top positions probably remaining in the hands of the same ministers.
Apart from Euclid Tsakalotos, who will return to his previous position as Greece's Finance Minister, the rest of the key ministerial positions are expected to remain the same, according to several party officials.
Panos Skourletis is expected to remain energy minister. The 53-year-old economist also served as labor minister in the previous Syriza-led government, before a reshuffle in July. He has been a party member for decades and has been close to Mr Tsipras.
George Stathakis, an academic and one of the most market-friendly Syriza members, is expected to return to the economy ministry. The 61-year-old vice-rector of the University of Crete took part in the latest round of tough negotiations with the country's international creditors.
Yannis Dragasakis is expected to retain his position as deputy prime minister, a role he served in the previous term of the left-wing government. The 68-year-old Syriza heavyweight was one of the most moderate figures in the government's previous term, but was also criticised by party officials for his reluctance to be more active in important decisions.
Other key ministers expected to keep their positions are the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Nikos Kotzias, and Defence Minister Panos Kammenos, leader of the government's junior coalition partner: Independent Greeks.
